alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson County; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 08 at 3:34AM MDT until September 08 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected Thursday... .Relative humidity values will drop into the 10 to 15 percent range across a large portion of the area today along and west of a line from McCook, Nebraska south to Oakley and Leoti, Kansas. This area will also see wind gusts in the 25 to 30 mph range. The combination of dry conditions, gusty winds, and fuels that are ready to burn will create critical fire weather conditions where any fire that starts may be impossible to control. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001, 002, 003, 013, 014, 027, 028, 041, 042, 079, 080, 081, 252, 253, AND 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne, Fire Weather Zone 002 Rawlins, Fire Weather Zone 003 Decatur, Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 014 Thomas, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. In Nebraska, Fire Weather Zone 079 Dundy, Fire Weather Zone 080 Hitchcock and Fire Weather Zone 081 Red Willow. * Winds...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: Avoid outdoor burning. Repeating, outdoor burning is not advised on Thursday. Any fires that start may rapidly grow and spread out of control.
